neighborhoods.name: Place de Jaude
neighborhoods.character: Modern, vibrant district known for its shopping, cafes, and contemporary atmosphere
neighborhoods.location: Central Clermont-Ferrand, the main square and surrounding area
neighborhoods.history: The heart of modern Clermont-Ferrand, featuring the iconic statue of Vercingetorix and surrounded by shopping centers, restaurants, and cultural venues

practical_info.getting_there: Central location, accessible by tram and bus

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Popular with shoppers, tourists, and locals seeking entertainment
neighborhoods.tips: Visit during the day for shopping and dining. The area is pedestrian-friendly and perfect for exploring modern Clermont-Ferrand.

neighborhoods.name: Le Suquet (Historic Center)
neighborhoods.character: Historic heart of the city with medieval architecture, narrow streets, and cultural landmarks
neighborhoods.location: Central Clermont-Ferrand, the old town area
neighborhoods.history: The medieval core of Clermont-Ferrand, featuring the iconic black volcanic stone architecture and the Notre-Dame-du-Port basilica, a UNESCO World Heritage site

practical_info.getting_there: Central location, accessible by tram and walking

neighborhoods.appeal: High - Essential for understanding Clermont-Ferrand's history and culture
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and get the best photos. Wear comfortable shoes for cobblestone streets. The area is perfect for walking tours and cultural immersion.

neighborhoods.name: Place du March√© Saint-Pierre
neighborhoods.character: Authentic local market area with traditional Auvergnat atmosphere and fresh produce
neighborhoods.location: Central Clermont-Ferrand, near the historic center
neighborhoods.history: Traditional market area that has maintained its authentic character while serving as the city's main food market for centuries

practical_info.getting_there: Walking distance from center, accessible by tram
practical_info.safety: Safe during market hours, be aware of crowds

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium-High - Great for experiencing local culture and finding fresh food
neighborhoods.tips: Visit early morning for the freshest produce and most authentic experience. Bring cash for purchases. Be respectful when taking photos of vendors and their goods.

neighborhoods.name: Jaude District
neighborhoods.character: Modern residential and commercial area with upscale developments and international businesses
neighborhoods.location: West of Place de Jaude, extending toward the outskirts
neighborhoods.history: Newer development area that has grown rapidly with Clermont-Ferrand's economic development and Michelin's presence

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Daytime for business, evening for dining
practical_info.getting_there: Tram connections, walking distance from center

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium - Good for business travelers and those seeking modern amenities
neighborhoods.tips: This area is more business-oriented and less touristy. Good for those seeking a quieter, more modern experience away from the tourist crowds.

neighborhoods.name: Port de Clermont
neighborhoods.character: Traditional residential area with authentic local life and some industrial heritage
neighborhoods.location: South of the city center, near the historic port area
neighborhoods.history: Originally an industrial and port area, now primarily residential with some remaining industrial buildings and Michelin facilities

practical_info.getting_there: Tram connections, walking distance from some areas

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium - Good for experiencing authentic local life
neighborhoods.tips: This is a working-class residential area, so be respectful of local life. Good for photographers seeking authentic scenes. Less tourist infrastructure than other areas.

neighborhoods.name: Montjuzet
neighborhoods.character: Scenic residential area with panoramic views and peaceful atmosphere
neighborhoods.location: Northwest of the city center, on a hill
neighborhoods.history: Residential area known for its elevated position offering spectacular views of Clermont-Ferrand and the surrounding volcanic landscape

practical_info.getting_there: Bus connections, walking uphill from center

neighborhoods.appeal: Medium-High - Excellent for views and photography
neighborhoods.tips: Visit during sunset for the most spectacular views. Bring a camera for panoramic shots of the city and surrounding volcanoes. The area is perfect for peaceful walks and relaxation.
